meanings.definition: To arrange or organize in a systematic way.
meanings.sent1: She marshalls her toys neatly on the shelf.
meanings.sent2: The librarian marshalls the books by genre.
meanings.sent3: The ants marshalls their food in a straight line.
meanings.sent4: The conductor marshalls the musicians for the performance.
meanings.sent5: He marshalls his thoughts before giving a speech.

meanings.definition: A person in charge of a group or activity.
meanings.sent1: The teacher is the marshalls of the classroom.
meanings.sent2: The team captain is a marshalls during the game.
meanings.sent3: The marshalls of the party made sure everyone had fun.
meanings.sent4: The marshalls of the event guided the attendees.
meanings.sent5: The marshalls of the meeting kept things running smoothly.

meanings.sent1: I bought a shirt from Marshalls yesterday.
meanings.sent2: Let's go shopping at Marshalls for some new shoes.
meanings.sent3: She loves finding great deals at Marshalls.
meanings.sent4: Marshalls always has a variety of home goods.
meanings.sent5: Marshalls is known for its discounted designer items.
